page.title: 10FARMING EMPLOYMENT HOUSING
page.content: Many previous farmhouses and their associated buildings are now empty; the land having been incorporated into larger farms. Some of the buildings have been sold though tythe cottages tend to be derelict. Economics and cost efficiency are the watchwords. The work is mechanised and many fewer men are employed. Some of the original workers still live in the area but commute to nearby towns where unemployment is high. New technical and chemical handling skills are required for weed, pest and disease control, as well as to encourage growth and yield. New strains of seed are used to maximise desirable features and eradicate previous plant weaknesses.
